intro: Euphrasia petiolaris, commonly known as the slender yellow-eyed grass, is a small herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features delicate, upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers clustered in dense spikes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia petiolaris thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
